name: The Killarney Park Hotel

reviews.title: A disapointment
reviews.text: The hotel itself is lovely but the staff are mostly foreign and poorly trained. With the exception of the reception staff who were friendly and welcoming the dining room staff spoke little English and were not particularly friendly or welcoming. The solmelier had absolutely no idea about wine - poured our wine by reaching across infront of us and offered wine to one of our party, "you want wine lady?" Not exactly what you expect of a 5* hotel with wines averaging £45 a bottle. Pool was clean, warm and quiet, infact all you could hope ...... but why are so many pools these days so SHALLOW! The deep end was only 150cms and for about a third of its length the pool is only 1 meter deep. I`m sure it`s very safe and great fun if swimming in a children`s pool is your thing............ perhaps that`s why the pool was always empty! The spa is good. Again Eastern European girls make up a high proportion of the staff but the treatments we had were excellent and the girls friendly. The food was only adequate at dinner and breakfast too was adequate. Beware the porridge unless you enjoy thin gruel! Would have preferred a breakfast buffet but that`s just a personal thing. So, overall what`s it like? Well it`s definitely NOT 5* standard, it`s a good 4* but quite an expensive one!

reviews.title: Really was one of best hotels we stayed, ever!
reviews.text: My wife and I took a one week tour of Ireland in Oct 2006. It took us a while to write the review but it was the best hotel we stayed on the tour and frankly, one of the best ever.

reviews.title: Great Surprise!
reviews.text: When our tour bus drove up to the entrance, it did look "nice" but not super impressive. Boy, were we in for a pleasant surprise. The hotel was beautiful and luxurious and the staff was professional. The lobby had a very modern feel to it but beyond that, the rest of the hotel definitely had a plush feel, from the carpeting, to the fireplace and leather chairs in the waiting areas and the wood paneling and artwork.

reviews.title: Never go on X-mas there
reviews.text: The rooms were very clean and spacious. The bathrooms as well. They definitely looked well kept. We ate breakfast and dinner in the hotel and the food was great.

reviews.title: Exceptiional Service, Accommodation, Ambience and Cuisine
reviews.text: It was in a great location in Killarney, with easy access to the center of town. You walk outside the hotel, cross the street (that can be tough since there isn't a good crosswalk) and then you can walk around Killarney and do some shopping if you life.

reviews.title: heavenonearth
reviews.text: I have travelled all over the world, and I could only describe this hotel as being heaven on earth. The staff were Incredible, the decor fantastic, the Day Spa services were bliss - just watch out for Mary she gives a mean Remedial Massage. We travelled all over Ireland and stayed twice at The Killarney Park Hotel, the 2nd time we visited we were immediately upgraded, well what a treat! I have absolutely no hesitation in recommending this Hotel 5 star all the way, luxury, luxury, and more luxury

reviews.title: Absolutely wonderful!
reviews.text: I stayed at Killarney Park for a meeting and was delighted at the property and the service. The hotel is immaculate, well located, and comfortable. The rooms are big and airy; the fireplace was lit each evening. The breakfast was classy yet comfortable. The pool and exercise room were amazing for a small hotel. However what makes the Killarney Park so amazing was the service. I swear that they could anticipate my requests even before I asked. I will certainly return for a holiday with my family!

reviews.title: not 5 star
reviews.text: a good 4 star hotel , very pleasant staff , but not good enough to deserve its 5 star rating.

reviews.title: as great as ever
reviews.text: it does not stack up against sheen falls or the equally excellent park in kenmare. suite was very nice apart from a drooning humming noise that went on all night. front desk could not explain it.

reviews.title: Lead by Example
reviews.text: sauna broken jacuzzi cold , only 2 loungers in a very small area in the pool surrounds.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: We tried to stay at the Best Western International, but being the weekend, we couldn't get a room. So, we walked across the street to the Killarney Park. It's a bit more posh than we wanted for the night, but it was a great stay. You are close to a lot of pubs and restaurants, and the shopping around the hotel is great. The room was great, and full of old world charm and character. They have a nice athletic facility, and its great to sit in the lobby and socialize around the fireplace.

reviews.title: Not An Irish Experience
reviews.text: This was by no means an Irish experience and we were disappointed accordingly. It is in a great place but the staff seemed to come from everywhere except Ireland and were not especially friendly or informative.The rooms were very small for the price we paid and we did not sleep sogood as there seemed to be a small party next door. The food was very good.

reviews.title: Comfort and class
reviews.text: My husband and 5 month old daughter spent 4 nights in the Killarney Park. It was a wonderful experience and the staff went out of their way to make things as comfortable as possible for us. We received a complementary upgrade to a suite which was a godsend as we had travelled with everything including the kitchen sink for the baby. A fridge and high chair were given to us for the room and at all times our request for privacy was adhered to as we tried to get the baby down for sleeps during the day. The pool was great and we were able to introduce our daughter to the joys of swimming. The treatments I had in the spa were very relxaing and I would definitely recommend. Food in the bar was delicious. Overall we had a wonderful stay that was made all the better by very friendly, helpful staff.

reviews.title: Expensive but Top Class!
reviews.text: Only stayed for one night on a stop over to Dingle in Kerry with my family but it proved to be a great hotel in an excellent location. There are other good 5 Star hotels outside of the Killarney Town but this is a great location if you want a central spot where all the bars and restaurants are in walking distance by night and also is a good base for trips to see the lakes and surrounding countryside.

reviews.title: Great family hotel
reviews.text: Most positive thing about the hotel is the staff who are always very helpful and know the area well - they even arranged to send some express documents for me over the weekend using their TNT account and followed up by phone after I left the hotel to confirm that the package was delivered.

reviews.title: Fantastic experience
reviews.text: This hotel was highly recommended by a friend and proved so.

reviews.title: Excellent 5* hotel
reviews.text: The staff were warm and so helpful. We have rarely have had a better stay away from home and away from friends.

reviews.title: Sadly below average, could have been anywhere.
reviews.text: Every little detail was just as we expected and we will definetely go back.

reviews.title: The goods and bads
reviews.text: PS beds so comfortable....

reviews.title: Second Time at Killarney Park Hotel
reviews.text: We visited the Killarney Park on basis of reviews on Tripadvisor, and were not disappointed. From the moment of walking into the hotel until we left, it was pure luxury. Very expensive, but as it was an anniversary treat it was definitely worth it. The hotel itself is very modern but cosy. Our room was huge, and more traditional decor but very comfortable. We ate in both the bar for snack food at lunch, and in the hotel restaurant one evening.....all food was excellent as was the service. Great atmosphere in the bar in the evening. Tried out the spa too - this was amazing. I would return here just for that. Lovely swimming pool with plunge pool and outdoor tub too.

description: The five star Killarney Park Hotel is wonderfully situated in the picturesque town of Killarney - Ireland's premier tourist destination - celebrated throughout the world for its magnificent scenery and welcoming people. Reflecting its location, the hotel offers guests the ultimate in luxury, in comfortable yet contemporary surroundings, whilst at all times offering flawless service and warmth beyond the smile. With 68 bedrooms, a full service Spa offering Elemis and Eve Lom, the Park Restaurant and Garden Bar in addition to the world class golf courses available in Kerry, the Killarney Park Hotel is your natural choice.
